intro: Urticastrum nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is adapted to grow in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Urticastrum nicaraguense is known for its milky sap, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
